content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Book a highly-rated hotel with a swimming pool and free WiFi near the Louvre Museum in Paris for the weekend of November 3-5, 2025.  Please interact with https://www.booking.com/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: To search for hotels near the Louvre Museum in Paris, I need to enter the destination in the search textbox. The appropriate textbox is likely element [14] labeled "Where are you going?"
Action: Type [14]; Louvre Museum, Paris
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.1
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar currently displays September and October 2025. I need to book for the weekend of November 3-5, 2025, so I need to move to the next month to access the November dates.
Action: Click [18]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.15
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar now shows November 2025. For the weekend of November 3-5, I need to select November 3 (Monday) as the check-in and November 5 (Wednesday) as the check-out dates.
Action: Click [63]
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.2
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: November 3 (Monday) is selected as the check-in date. Now, I need to select November 5 (Wednesday) as the check-out date to complete the required range.
Action: Click [65]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.25
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The dates and location are set. I now need to filter the results for "Free Wifi" and swimming pool. The "Free Wifi" option is clearly available under "Filter by: Popular filters" as element [26]. I should select it first.
Action: Click [26]
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.35
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "Free Wifi" filter is now applied. I still need to add the "Swimming Pool" filter, which isn't visible on the current screenshot. I should scroll down the filter section to locate and select the "Swimming Pool" option.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.4
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I scrolled down the filter menu, but the "Swimming Pool" filter is still not visible. I need to continue scrolling down to locate the "Swimming Pool" filter option.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.45
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I still don’t see the "Swimming Pool" filter option. Since there are more property facilities listed, I should keep scrolling down to find the "Swimming Pool" filter to match the task criteria.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The option to "Show all 15" under Room facilities (element [40]) likely expands additional filters, which may include the "Swimming Pool" option. I should click this to reveal more facility filters.
Action: Click [40]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.55
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The expanded list now shows "Private pool" (element [44]). However, this is not the general 'swimming pool' filter; it's for private pools, which are rare and not the same. There is still no visible general "Swimming pool" facility. I should scroll down a bit more to see if a standard "Swimming pool" option appears.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.9
Completion: 0.6
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: After reviewing the expanded filters, there is still no generic "Swimming pool" filter visible—only "Private pool" is present. This may indicate that very few properties near the Louvre offer a swimming pool, or that "Swimming pool" might not be available as a filter. The search results do, however, display hotels with free WiFi and high ratings very close to the Louvre. The top listed hotel that is highly-rated, offers free WiFi (scored 9.4), and is 0.7 km from the Louvre is "Hotel Louvre Montana".
Action: Click [69]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.8
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar overlay is still up but the previously found hotel information matches the requirements except for the explicit "swimming pool" filter. I need to close the calendar or confirm the dates to continue. The next best action to return to the list view is to click the "Search" button (element [98]) and proceed with booking details.
Action: Click [98]
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.85

Currently selected: 2 adults · 0 children · 1 room";	[17]: <button> "Search";	[18]: "Home";	[19]: "France";	[20]: "Ile de France";	[21]: "Paris";	[22]: "Louvre Museum";	[23]: "Search results";	[24]: <button> "Show on map";	[26]: "Free Wifi";	[27]: "4993";	[28]: "List";	[29]: "Grid";	[30]: <button> "Sort by: Our top picks";	[32]: <button> "Next";	[33]: <button> "Save this item to a trip list";	[34]: "Hôtel Barnett ParisOpens in new window";	[35]: "18th arr., ParisShow on map";	[36]: "Scored 9.5 9.5Exceptional 18 reviews";	[37]: "Location 9.6", "Location: Scored 9.6 ";	[38]: "1 queen bed";	[39]: "See availability";

content:
Thought: The hotel shown at the top of the list, "Hôtel Barnett Paris," is very highly rated (9.5) and offers free WiFi, but it is located in the 18th arrondissement (3.4 km from the Louvre Museum), which is not "near" the Louvre. The location does not match the proximity requirement. I need to scroll down to check if hotels closer to the Louvre that meet all criteria (high rating, free WiFi, swimming pool) are available.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.87

content:
Thought: I see hotels listed with ratings and their distances from the Louvre Museum. The "Welcome Hotel" in the 6th arrondissement is only 0.9 km from the Louvre (close enough to be considered "near"), has a high rating (8.6), free WiFi, and excellent location score. However, I still do not see an explicit swimming pool feature mentioned for this or the other listings so far. I should continue scrolling to look for a hotel that clearly lists a swimming pool.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.93
Completion: 0.9

content:
Thought: The listings shown—Hôtel Albe Saint Michel (5th arr., Paris, 1 km from the Louvre, rated 8.7) and Citadines Les Halles Paris (1st arr., Paris, very close and rated 8.7)—both match the location and high rating requirements. However, I still don't see "swimming pool" listed as a facility for these options, nor any such icon or mention in the visible room facilities or popular filters. To make doubly sure, I should expand "Show all 12" under the landmarks section to see if there are additional facilities or more property features that include a swimming pool filter.
Action: Click [27]
Confidence: 0.9
Completion: 0.93
